head.title: Talking to the Streets for Art

hedline.hl1: Talking to the Streets for Art

body.head.byline: By ALLISON FASS and LIZ MURRAY

block.p: TRAFFIC will come to a halt for a mile along on Fifth Avenue Tuesday evening as nine museums take to the streets for the 22nd annual Museum Mile Festival (part of last year's is shown above). The action will take place from 82nd to 104th Street. For the first time, several of the museums will offer outdoor art activities, including chalk art and seven-foot pieces of chalk for families to play with. Twentieth-century New York will be celebrated in an event called Mapping Memories, and outside the National Academy of Design, children 9 to 12 will be shown how to sketch a live model. Musicians will perform in front of the museums.

TRAFFIC will come to a halt for a mile along on Fifth Avenue Tuesday evening as nine museums take to the streets for the 22nd annual Museum Mile Festival (part of last year's is shown above). The action will take place from 82nd to 104th Street. For the first time, several of the museums will offer outdoor art activities, including chalk art and seven-foot pieces of chalk for families to play with. Twentieth-century New York will be celebrated in an event called Mapping Memories, and outside the National Academy of Design, children 9 to 12 will be shown how to sketch a live model. Musicians will perform in front of the museums.

The participants, from north to south, are El Museo del Barrio; the Museum of the City of New York; the International Center of Photography; the Jewish Museum; the Cooper-Hewitt National Design Museum; the National Academy of Design; the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum; the Goethe-Institut New York/German Cultural Center; and the Metropolitan Museum of Art. This year's opening ceremony will take place at 5:45 at the National Academy of Design.
Museum Mile Festival, Tuesday, 5:45 until 9 p.m.; in case of rain all events will be moved indoors; free; (212) 606-2296.
